availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Jefferson Sweeney (Edmonson County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Edmonson County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Margaret Sarah Caroline Johnson in Edmonson County on May 29, 1847. Father of Mary D. Sweeney and Robert E. Sweeney. Farmer in Edmonson County in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in 1850. Farmer in Brownsville, Edmonson County, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Edmonson County, p. 11B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Edmonson County, p. 2 /4 on microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Edmonson County, Brownsville, p. 106.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Edmonson County Marriages, Film #000367221, p. 7.
Find A Grave, "Thomas Jefferson Sweeney (1802-1869)," Memorial #13057395, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/13057395 (accessed June 7, 2020).
